args:
Prometheus joins the party and helps defeat
fiends. In the middle of the battle, however,
his power goes out of control and ends up
hurting the prince. This is their first taste of
his awesome strength—and the very reason
why Prometheus has long avoided humanity.
That was a hell of a sigh there, pal.\nNot a fan'a fiend-slayin'?
Well, yer injuries have healed,\nso let's get on with it already.
Hrm? It seems your rather noisy dragon\nfriend has decided not to join us.
A dragon's strength is a necessary\nforce to survive any battle.
Yeah, no worries on that front.
Even when we're not together,\nshe still lends us her strength.
These are the fiends that have been\nmenacing the region. Let us dispatch\nthem with all haste!
Gya! There ain't no end to 'em!\n...Er, how's that, {player_name}?
...Take 'em all out at once? Hey, good\nthinkin'—guess that's why you make the\nbig coin. Now let's bust some heads!
By all in heaven and earth...
Ha! Did we not mention our ＂frail＂\nhuman friend here can shapeshift?
I have heard tell of this...shapeshifting.
That is Mym's true form:\nthe flamewyrm Brunhilda.
Yes. Now come, Your Highness.\nLet us return home.
Are you all right, Your Highness?!
Hey, watch what yer doin', yeah?!\nIt ain't safe to just be tossin' around\ncrazy powerful attacks like that!
Hence why I told him to take heed.
Yeah, the warning usually comes BEFORE\nit's too late to avoid the deadly attack.
He's sustained some light burns.\nWe should apply first aid and then\nhurry back to the castle!
You will pay for hurting him!
I gave the human fair warning.\nHe was merely too slow.
You're lucky he just sustained a burn.\nThis could have been so much worse!
Such foolishness is why I detest humans.
They are frail, pathetic creatures\nunfit for battle of any kind!\nThat's why— ...Hmph. Nevermind.
Prometheus! Get back here!\nI'm not done talking to you!
...Hmm? Wait, my darling left as well?\nWhere did everyone go?!
I apologize for burning you earlier.\nI can only assume your tender pink\nflesh is causing you agonizing pain.
I know you humans are frail creatures,\nand yet I managed to injure you anyway.
...Hmm? Do I detest humans?\nNo, it is not that.
But if you are truly curious, I will\nilluminate my feelings on the matter.
Roughly a millennium ago, humanity\ncast off the shackles of civilization\nand began to live amidst the wilds.
In one particularly remote border region,\nthe rain fell without pause.
Using fire was difficult, and the people\nthere endured a harsh existence.
After a while, I took it upon myself to\ngive them the power of flame. Naturally,\nthey were quite delighted by this.
They used the magic I had taught them\nto warm themselves and prepare food,\nand soon their lives were bountiful.
A fire broke out. An unplanned one.
My magic was too powerful,\nand they could not control it.
In a single night, the magical flames\ndevoured their village, and they lost\neverything.
I gave them fire to be their salvation,\nand instead it took all from them.
I learned then my power is too great;\nit can be the salvation of nothing.
And so, I severed all ties with humans\nfor many an age.
But lately, I had seen fiends attack\nthe village where you and I first met.
I decided to offer them my aid—\na foolish decision, as you saw.
All I did was destroy the village,\nwhich proves my self-imposed exile\nwas the better decision all along.
I apologize for all who have suffered\nbecause of my actions.
Aaaaah ha ha ha! Oh, I had been\nwondering how you might respond\nto my little tale!
Then you would form a pact with me?
How curious you would attempt this\nso soon after being wounded.
It seems I may have misjudged at least\na few members of your frail race.
I've been looking EVERYWHERE for you!\nIt's almost dinner time. Hurry up and...
What's with that look? Relax, I'm over it.\nAnd as you can see, even my darling\nhimself isn't angry.
That's just the kind of person he is.\nHe's not frail—quite the opposite, in fact.
Hmm. You may be right, at that.
I hope you remember this in the future!\nNow come on. Let's go.
This castle truly is full of\ninteresting people...
Likely because this prince of theirs is\nsuch an interesting person himself.
